intro: Psychotria yapasensis, commonly known as the Yapas Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in lowland rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
